Sexually dimorphic nucleus of the preopt.CytoDefiningCriteria: Characterized by intensely staining large cells 10-15 um in diameter.  The sexual dimorphism appears to be due to an increase in the number of cells rather than the packing density.
Sexually dimorphic nucleus of the preopt.EditorialNote: Not sure whether this belongs as part of the medial preoptic region
Sexually dimorphic nucleus of the preopt.Definition: Nucleus in the medial preoptic area that shows marked sexual dimorphism, being much larger in the male than the female.
